page.title: 08THE LOLLIPOP MAN.
page.content: On a morning at about 8.20a.m. Mr. Bell starts work. He guides us across the road. He stands near the fence at our school and we wait for him to come across the road. He wears a big, white coat and a hat. When it is raining or when it is snowing he never fails to come. When he is tired and weary he is still there every morning. When he is sick, a policeman comes. The policeman stops the traffic by holding up his arm but Mr. Bell stops the traffic by holding up his lollipop which is a big piece of metal with a sign at the top saying STOP CHILDREN. Mr. Bell started to work here on 17th March, 1980. At the end of term he gives us sweets and a packet of lollies. He is the kindest, nicest lollipop man in the whole wide world.
